ratings.question_text: What percentage of the reading and other assignments did you complete?

narratives.question_text: How well was the course organized?
comments: Magda organized the class around the bodies in the room. This was an exciting and important aspect of this class because while we had a very in depth syllabus that was followed if something struck us deeply about a particular reading Magda would steer the class towards that space and allow us to tease out our idea so that we could leave the room that day with a fully formed relationship to what we were reading instead of a largely shallow one.
The discussion at every class meeting built on previous discussions. The assigned readings were well structured throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: How effective was the balance between instruction and discussion?
comments: Very effective.

narratives.question_text: How well did the assigned papers, reports or other projects reflect the aims of the course?
comments: Professor Nyong'o actively helped shape each project so that it fit the student's specializations and interests. I thought the balance struck between structure and freedom, and the emphasis on class feedback throughout one's process was very useful.

I'm so incredibly proud of my final project. I don't think that it would have been posssible to get to the head space I arrived at on how to conceive this play had it not been for the aims and priorities of this course.
The ability to choose our own final paper topics was helpful. It allowed me to synthesize the assigned readings/class discussions and use the material for my own studies.

narratives.question_text: How did the amount of assigned reading work with weekly discussion?
comments: There were rumblings about the work load being too high for a class cross-listed with the School of Drama. I would disagree, but I do think it will take a few more tries before YSD students develop the strategies necessary to get most of the reading in.
Never too much that I felt overwhelmed. A lot I'm excited to revisit with more time.
The reading load was fairly high, but we were able to still hold valuable discussions.
Yes, interacting with the work of Dorsen, Narcisster and others was incredibly informative.

narratives.question_text: The course filled a significant gap in your knowledge of the field.
comments: Absolutely. There is very little engagement with Performance Studies, Critical Race Theory, Black Studies, or American Studies at YSD. These disciplines offer necessary insights, critical tools, and a fair number of questions we probably should be dealing with given the amount of cultural material we produce in a year.

I toook this course because not only did it interest me but I also had no grasp on the theories that we would explore. I now feel articulate in a form of theatre taught no where else in this institution and I am forever grateful for that because much of what we learn here has isn't mutable, doesn't exist within an area of inquiry that I could see myself making huge contributions to and in this one I do.

No other course in the drama school gives us a grounding in contemporary performance, art theory, black studies or radical race theory. This course is unique and formative also in its cross-listing with the school of art and American Studies. Studying with these other students was a rare and valuable opportunity.

narratives.question_text: Regardless of whether or not the course is required, would you recommend it to other students in and outside the department?
comments: Yes.

Completely, if only to come into contact with a mind like that of Magda. She is so incredibly inquisitive and insightful and discerning that I feel like I grew in so many ways I never imagined in this course.
Yes. It is one of the best courses I have taken in my academic career.

narratives.question_text: The course goals were clearly presented.
comments: Yes.

narratives.question_text: The instructor has a strong grasp of the course subject matter.
comments: We often seemed to barely scrape the surface of Professor Nyong'o expertise and thoughtfulness on the topics we covered.
She's a leader in thi sfield.

narratives.question_text: The instructor presented the subject matter effectively.
comments: Whenever I had questions, misgivings, or challenges to the work Magda sparred and responded to me with candor, grace, and deep intellectual guidance.
Not only did he present the subject matter well, but we were able to, as a class, present and teach the subject matter to each other, in an organic way.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to consider diverse points of view.
comments: See above response.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to answer pertinent questions.
comments: Always.

narratives.question_text: The grading criteria was clearly explained.
comments: Yes.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was available for consultation, discussion and advice.
comments: There were many ways to reach Magda that she made very known on day 1.

narratives.question_text: I would recommend this instructor to other students.
comments: Yes, especially interested students at YSD.
See above.

narratives.question_text: How many of the 14 class meetings did you attend?  Comments:
comments: Thirteen
I missed one because of illness.
All 14

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments you have on such topics as: what worked best about the course, what improvements you would suggest, etc.
comments: This percentage reflects more on my continued attempt to adjust to my constantly changing schedule than anything else.
What worked best was Magda's commitment to us. What could be improved is the school hiring Magda to come back and teach this class again at a time when more students could also take it.
The Drama School (and especially the Dramaturgy department) needs more courses like this. We need more contemporary theory and more theoretical conversations on race.
